website_summaries.verdict: A fairly well-appointed emergency kit with hand-crank radio and other essentials, but the backpack may be too flimsy for rough conditions.
pros: A decent kit with most of the essentials to help in the short-term after an earthquake
Whistle, goggles and heavy-duty gloves are nice additions, users note
cons: Backpack is not waterproof and zipper breaks easily
Reports of water boxes leaking on arrival
Owners feel included food and water isn’t enough to sustain four people

website_summaries.verdict: A fairly well-appointed emergency kit with a hand-crank radio and other essentials, but the backpack may be too flimsy for rough conditions.
pros: A decent kit with most of the essentials to help in the short term after a natural disaster
Whistle, goggles, and heavy-duty gloves are nice additions, users note
cons: Backpack isn't waterproof, and zipper breaks easily
Reports of water boxes leaking on arrival
Owners feel included food and water isn’t enough to sustain 4 people

customer_reviews.title: Outdated cell phone charger!
customer_reviews.text: I would have given it a 4 -5 star BUT the cell phone charger is for an iPhone 4!! The description did not say this. Who has an iPhone 4 anymore? Does anyone know what kind of adapter I could purchase to make this charger work?
customer_reviews.author: Mommynurs

customer_reviews.title: A good start
customer_reviews.text: I agree with other reviews that this is not all you need to survive comfortably, however it is a good start. Comes with a lot of cool stuff. We will be adding life straws and granola bars and trail mix. Also added a deck of cards. Peanut butter is a great idea too. Lots of protein and unopened, pb will last next to forever. Anyway, don't expect perfection.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie RussellTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: Product not as advertised!
customer_reviews.text: This product is not as advertised! I didn't even open the backpack because mine showed up as camouflage instead of bright red. In an emergency with potentially low light, why would I want my key to survival be hard to find?!? I am returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: There's no way theres enough food/water for 4 to survive 3 days!
customer_reviews.text: There is barely enough food and water for one person to survive a day! This is described a a 3 day survival pack for four people. WRONG! Don't be mislead!
customer_reviews.author: Yonger

customer_reviews.title: Zipper broke the second time the bag was opened. Yikes.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this in 2014. Opened it today to confirm expiration dates on perishable items. Zipper pull snapped off in my hand, making the bag nearly useless to transport in an emergency. This is only the second time it has ever been opened - once upon purchase to inspect the contents and add some emergency cash.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Brown

customer_reviews.title: It's ok. Mine arrived all wet as 2 of ...
customer_reviews.text: It's ok. Mine arrived all wet as 2 of the 4 water containers had leaked due to faulty closures (not their fault) ... but they should have put aluminum cans instead (pouches can puncture due to their sharp corners and water in a milk box, really? for long shelf life?). Good-enough to grab on the go, but this is for 1 person/ 4 days or 4 people/1 day ... no more! I needed to create 20 emergency kits for my business employees and guests ... decided to make my own instead. Open it, and see if it fits your needs. And make sure all is dry inside!!!
customer_reviews.author: Frequency

customer_reviews.title: advertised as 5-year shelf life, expires in 4 years?!? Disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: I received the box and one of the water boxes was busted open with water running through the box. Also, they advertise their products having 5-year shelf life. I bought the kit in July 2019, and the products have an expiration date of 6/2023...that’s 4 years. Quite disappointed in my experience with their product so far.
customer_reviews.author: Luc

customer_reviews.title: Good but still needs work
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had to use his yet but the bag is not strong at all it also pretty heavy if you have to truck on foot, but it does come with necessary items you will need during a time of crisis. I added more items that me and my family would need in a time of crisis ( we're also avid campers ) I would suggest buying add-ons that would fit you and your family's emergency plan And a much stronger bag. But overall this bag is a good start
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: Not ready for emergency
customer_reviews.text: The kit contains everything as advertised, but it is far from ready for any emergency. To start, it is a very compact kit in a flimsy/thin backpack. The food/water portion feels more like a 1-person, 3 day pack instead of a 4-person pack. As another reviewer pointed out, the food has 5-yr shelf life but it was made in 2018, so you will be replacing them in 4 years. May or may not be a problem for you, YMMV.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas L.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed... Water leaked all over package and damaged bag and radio
customer_reviews.text: One of the water containers leaked all over bag and supplies. Radio came soaked and not sure if it will work. Waters say 5yr shelf life except three of them have a best by date of 2021... Which makes them good for only one year. If I could return I would just to get a replacement backpack, water that leaked and radio. Disappointed with amount of money paid to have a damaged product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: We added water and food to a kit and we're comfortable knowing that we will be safe for days or a quick evacuation.
customer_reviews.text: With being new to an earthquake prone area, it is so comforting to know that Ready America has done a lot of the work for us putting together such a great emergency kit. We added water and food to a kit and we're comfortable knowing that we will be safe for days or a quick evacuation.
customer_reviews.author: Twinkler

customer_reviews.title: Zipper broke off, cheap backpack
customer_reviews.text: Had this in my garage for 4 years, and when I openned it to make use of masks (CA fires), zipper simply broke off, and material is so rigit now that a pull will make it rip. I wouldn’t trust this as something to gran and run in case of emergency. Backpack willl just rip apart, such a poor quality.
customer_reviews.author: Mick H

customer_reviews.title: Misleading description
customer_reviews.text: The item description says it's made for 4 people to survive 72 hours but it has food and water for 1 person a day (4 boxes of water, 4 Mayday packs). In addition to that the cellphone charger is outdated and the backpack's zipper is really delicate. Everytime I open it it feels like it's about the break. The shoulder straps won't hold in place after adjusting them and the backpack falls back because of the weight. It looks good on the surface and has the basics needed in an emergency but it's not enough water and food for 4 people in 72 hours and the backpack itself isn't durable or sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: Poor QC - missing and damaged items
customer_reviews.text: The item showed up in mostly good shape, but a number of individual items inside the backpack had damaged packaging. Also, the 107-piece First Aid kit wasn't even there! Unfortunately one of the food rations was one of the damaged items. You can see in the pictures that the vacuum seal one one of them is broken and it clearly states "do not consume if vacuum seal is broken." This thing took almost 5 months to show up so there's no way I'm waiting for a whole new kit. Maybe they can send a food pack and a first-aid kit? This is pretty basic QC stuff we're talking about.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Great kit, but the packaging is faulty.
customer_reviews.text: Overall, I like the kit. However something needs to be done about the way the water is packed. Upon receiving the box, I noticed it was a little damp. We have had some rain so I didn't think much of it but when I started to unpack, I noticed everything inside the boxes was even wetter and it got worse. It turned out two of the water boxes were leaking and it had soaked through everything. Amazon was great and is replacing it free of charge without me having to ship it back, which would be a nightmare since everything is soaked.
customer_reviews.author: Shiloh W.

customer_reviews.title: Worth considering
customer_reviews.text: handy assortment of items that one might not think about. In terms of emergency, I probably would not of thought of all the items included but during an emergency, something insignificant becomes critically important. For that reason I think the emergency kit is worth the money. I would suggest keeping an eye on the water as there is a shelf life of 5 to seven years. Otherwise everything else can be stored away for an extended period of time with out worry.
customer_reviews.author: R. Vargo

customer_reviews.title: Earlier than described expiration date
customer_reviews.text: Product came with an expiration date of 06/2023... slightly less than 4 years after we ordered product (07/2019). When purchasing the product, the description said that it had a 5 year shelf life. We are grateful that we have the product at this point but disappointed that the description of how long it would last was incorrect.
customer_reviews.author: D.B.

customer_reviews.title: Ok for the money.
customer_reviews.text: The backpack is pretty cheap and flimsy. Not to mention it is camouflage. Wouldn't I WANT to find it in a disaster? A bright orange or red (as pictured) would make more sense. Anyway, it contains all that is described. If you don't have the time or inclination to build your own this will do fine.
customer_reviews.author: Brufam

customer_reviews.title: Flashlight was turned ON when I receive it and light bulbs are burned out.
customer_reviews.text: The flashlight/radio/ charger was on when I received the package. The light must been turned on for long time, and 2 light bulbs out of 3 are burned out. I'm not going to return it since it's so heavy and live in the boonies.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This item is Misleading!
customer_reviews.text: The item was not as described in the item description. I recalled that the item stated is made in the USA, it is not. Many of the components of the item are made in China. The backpack is good value. The medical supplies is OK but not as good as USA MADE products. The amount water is insufficient but should have potable water pills that I added to my kit and more light sticks and medical supplies.
customer_reviews.author: I like things that are right

customer_reviews.title: Be aware of expiration dates!!
customer_reviews.text: I just received mine. I was pretty impressed. However, take in consideration that expiration date for important items in the First Aid Kid is 9 months from today!! Also the food and water will expire sooner than expected, although when you buy its says shelf life is 5 years. Mine arrived today and it’s expiration date is in 01/2023.
customer_reviews.author: Xindyrella

customer_reviews.title: not what I was expecting
customer_reviews.text: unfortunately not the quality that I was expecting for the price. The content is very heavy for the quality of the backpack. As First Responder I'm very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: encallao

customer_reviews.title: shelf life
customer_reviews.text: We bought 3 of these. All had decreased shelf life with expiration dates of May or June 2023. Also one of them had no food or water. Returned all 3.
customer_reviews.author: lexi18

customer_reviews.title: How can you carry this backpack when the straps are broken?
customer_reviews.text: Looks good at first glance. But when I put the backpack on, both left sides straps ripped on top. On BOTH of my orders (1 per car). Backpacks are not well made and didn’t even double check if everything was inside. Just seems all thrown in there.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Missing my masks
customer_reviews.text: This is a good basic kit for minor emergencies, my biggest issue is that I did NOT receive the N95 (or any other) masks that should have been included in this kit (I can easily order some, but that is no the point) I have already added a few more medical supplies, my prescription Meds, more water tablets, food and a couple survival knives to my pack. Even if I added nothing this would work in an emergency which is what is is designed to do.... Although missing items is not acceptable.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberlee parkhouse

customer_reviews.title: I am very happy with my purchase
customer_reviews.text: I’m that person who is always on the road traveling long distance so it was a no brainer that I needed an emergency kit in case something happened. When searching I had something else in my but I couldn’t pass up the price and all the stuff that was included in the backpack. It let you know the longevity of the items being purchased. I am very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Juanita Walker

customer_reviews.title: Not packed properly causing damage
customer_reviews.text: The pack was received while I was traveling out of town so my return period has expired ! But the pack itself is very cheap ,materials so I will replace that with another back pack . For the items inside they seem okay , but one of the water packs was all the way out of the pack and punctured . Luckily it did not leak out before I opened it . Seems like this one was a return or something as the box inside the Amazon Box was poorly taped ? May be better to just buy your own backpack and fill it yourself .
customer_reviews.author: shanghai-jim

customer_reviews.title: Get it for peace of mind!
customer_reviews.text: This backpack is jam packed with the items listed. Hope I never need to use it, but feel secure in having it at home!
customer_reviews.author: Tell Me More

customer_reviews.title: 2 or 4
customer_reviews.text: Pretty nice kit for the money. Bag appears to be durable. Only a couple of zippered pocket areas. I feel it really would be for 2 persons.
customer_reviews.author: Leah

customer_reviews.title: Products were damaged by the water boxes that arrived broken
customer_reviews.text: Very very discontent with the products ordered!! I sent these items as a gift to family members living in Puerto Rico during these constant earthquakes. When my family who desperately needed these items opened the backpack found all the waters broken and all the supplies wet. Returning the item is now such a hassel with all thats going on the the island! Exchanging the item will take too long.
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa Diaz

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy material for backpack
customer_reviews.text: Very bad quality backpack. Looks and feels really flimsy, very heavy and am afraid it will break in a few walks. Recommend another that uses harder and stronger material for the pack.
customer_reviews.author: Adriana Cernat

customer_reviews.title: Broke by itself - not designed for emergencies!
customer_reviews.text: This initially looked like a good product. But after being stored for a couple years with no use, next time I tried to open, the zipper broke, and then even the handle on the zipper broke in 2! This product is not designed for emergencies!
customer_reviews.author: OS

customer_reviews.title: Impressed
customer_reviews.text: So much stuff! I just wish they were specific on the type of backpack they sent. Odd print but it’s just an emergency pack not a fashion statement. You will need a supplemental pack for food and emergency water filter.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria

customer_reviews.title: Water Package Leak.
customer_reviews.text: When we received a wet package, we foudn out the water leaked. It seemed like to be cut by a knife or sharp stuff. See the picture.
customer_reviews.author: L. Lan

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I needed to feel like I have prepared my family for a natural disaster or unforeseen occurrence, it is practical and well equipped, may not be the best quality but will be fine if needed, I'm a mommy and I don't want to get to paranoid trying to prepare for something to go wrong, but besides adding some water drops and some fun games because we will definitely need more water if something happens and need some time occupying items this was a pretty well equipped product for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel & Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Good to have
customer_reviews.text: Lots of supply. enough for me to split that into two sets to have one in my car and one in my house
customer_reviews.author: Felix C.

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Well done as usual. Have 5 of these. Well thought out practical bag. Always have at least one with us at all times
customer_reviews.author: Jfirearrow

customer_reviews.title: Everything it says it is.
customer_reviews.text: I'm sure I'll love this thing more when I'm in dire need. It has everything that the description listed. I chose this over the Costco American Preparedness because it was half the price. The only differences that I could see were that the Ready America had an emergency power station for my phone, and the American Preparedness had a crowbar. Ummm, I'd rather have a rechargeable docking station. A crow bar is more like an end of the world scenario where you needed it to fight off zombies. Anyhow, it is low in water supply as others have posted, but in a situation like this, you had better have a water supply somewhere, not in your backpack.
customer_reviews.author: ely

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as described
customer_reviews.text: The bars look kinda gross but it would be a last last resort. If they were gluten free they would be perfect for me! Nice little pack for my family of 4.
customer_reviews.author: icobb83

customer_reviews.title: Nice set
customer_reviews.text: This contains almost everything I could need if the big earthquake ever hits SF. Does it all work? Well, I hope I never need to find out. It's good to have this in the house though.
customer_reviews.author: Londonnoise

customer_reviews.title: Emergency bag
customer_reviews.text: Excellent for the moment we are living. Cover all necessary for 3 persons
customer_reviews.author: Lissette Perez Vega

customer_reviews.title: a lot of the items look like they came from the dollar tree
customer_reviews.text: Its ok, a lot of the items look like they came from the dollar tree. Probably could make your own bag with dollar tree items cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied with Kit
customer_reviews.text: Came with everything on the list, I added 4 Lifestraws in the backpack, SurvivalSPARK Magnesium Survival fire starter and 6 extra gold and silver emergency blankets. There is room to add a marker or two and extra duck tape and quality is fine. The water is in pouches instead of bricks which I like better.
customer_reviews.author: VH

customer_reviews.title: Theres Nothing like letting everyone know you have resources when you only ...
customer_reviews.text: Just wish the bag didnt have the name on it. Theres Nothing like letting everyone know you have resources when you only have enough for my family.
customer_reviews.author: Gavin Jackson

customer_reviews.title: One never knows, it just a little peace of mind, in these chaotic times.
customer_reviews.text: I gave these as gifts to by adult children. One never knows, it just a little peace of mind, in these chaotic times.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Santoleri

customer_reviews.title: in my opinion
customer_reviews.text: the actual back pack is not good quality, chintzy.... some of the accessories inside were decent, but most of it was lower quality..
customer_reviews.author: Sally

customer_reviews.title: Warning on the Backpack Label!!
customer_reviews.text: I tired to put a kit together myself but found that this one was cheaper and I was satisfied with the quality of its contents. However, the PVC wrap of the backpack handle does contain phthalates which cause it to come with a warning that says “This backpack contains chemicals know to the State of CA to cause cancer and birth defects or other reproductive harm.” I had to email Ready America to get the specifics of why the label came on the backpack.
customer_reviews.author: Small Business Owner

customer_reviews.title: great items
customer_reviews.text: this is great. I bought for Christmas gift...I like it so much that I want one for everyone. great price too
customer_reviews.author: Phoebe

customer_reviews.title: Food item has 2 years.
customer_reviews.text: Item expire in 3 years, it’s supposed to have 5 years expiration date.
customer_reviews.author: Alice

customer_reviews.title: Very Prepared
customer_reviews.text: Awesome kit! Need to get one for each of my son's!
customer_reviews.author: Bree

customer_reviews.title: Well Stocked
customer_reviews.text: Hope I don't need this anytime soon but it is great
customer_reviews.author: Russ L Dossa

customer_reviews.title: Better safe than sorry
customer_reviews.text: Got two of these for the house. I have one in our house and one in my car now so we can be ready when the need arises. I wouldn't say that the items in here are the best of quality, however they'll be fine as a start. Since it comes with a bag already I'm going to be adding items to it slowly.
customer_reviews.author: dj

customer_reviews.title: Can't miss out on emergency preparedness!
customer_reviews.text: Beware - when you purchase, this is VERY VERY heavy. Great project. I now feel a bit more prepared.
customer_reviews.author: kerryfan

customer_reviews.title: like an earthquake
customer_reviews.text: It has everything that my husband & I might need, in the event of a natural disaster, like an earthquake. The only things I still have to add are personal items, like medications.
customer_reviews.author: DusterMom

customer_reviews.title: Problem developed while stored for use
customer_reviews.text: I was pleased with the selection and packaging of this much needed item. I did encounter a problem after storage for 6 months that the water had leaked and wet the backpack. I got a satisfactory resolution to my problem from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Fran W. Messick

customer_reviews.title: The phone charger is not useful.
customer_reviews.text: The item I was looking forward to the most was the crank radio and phone charger. However the phone charger is only good for iPhone 4 and earlier. Also, the food expires in 3 years, not 5.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... every thing you need for a 4 day supply great back pack
customer_reviews.text: has every thing you need for a 4 day supply great back pack.
customer_reviews.author: cheltez Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Not as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I’m pretty sure it said a 5 year shelf life for this food and water but the expiration date says not...
customer_reviews.author: Christinna Gutierrez Gallegos♥️

customer_reviews.title: Much heavier than expected
customer_reviews.text: only found fault with the Power Station which did not work. Everything else was just fine, although with that much weight it is impossible to use (for me anyhow) as a backpack. I'll probably buy a rolling suitcase instead.
customer_reviews.author: Gayle Hansen

customer_reviews.title: Good deal but add an adapter
customer_reviews.text: This is a good deal but the plug for the radio to charge your phone is super old it's not even iPhone so don't forget to pack an adapter !
customer_reviews.author: J. Brown

customer_reviews.title: REady for the zombie apocalypse.
customer_reviews.text: This pack makes me feel a little more prepared for my family in case of the inevitable zombie apocalypse. I had no issues with the water packs as previous reviews mentioned. I do agree that there is a bit of room left to add your own personal small things too.
customer_reviews.author: JenoftheSea

customer_reviews.title: Great Pack
customer_reviews.text: We just moved to Tornado Alley and needed a kit. Bought this one for the 4-in-1 Power Station and every thing looks great. The radio feature was a little hard to dial in at first but apparently our NOAA station near us was damaged in a storm so not sure how well it will work once it is repaired. Flashlight is nice and bright and recharges quickly. Backpack is full when you first receive it however once you take out the extra packing and rearrange everything there's plenty of room for extras. I put baby items in for our son and some walkie talkies.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie

customer_reviews.title: Perfect grab and go kit
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for grabbing to go if you need to leave the house in a hurry. Small size makes it unobtrusive and not too heavy to carry. We added individual filtered straws to ours.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Please check the contents of the order
customer_reviews.text: Two of my water packets are leaking. I just discovered it. The plastic zip lock or cardboard box was never opened until today. I was checking the contents.
customer_reviews.author: Charles D. Bennett

customer_reviews.title: Love it, came with just what we needed
customer_reviews.text: Love it, came with just what we needed. We used this to help make safety bars for our family in case of an emergency. We homeschool and did it as a health and safety lesson.
customer_reviews.author: VMG

customer_reviews.title: A MUST HAVE SURVIVAL KIT
customer_reviews.text: A must have! This kit is packed with necessities for a disaster! My whole family has bought one of these survival kits! No problem with order. Good price, too.
customer_reviews.author: For Better Health

customer_reviews.title: have it sitting ready to grab and go.. ...
customer_reviews.text: have it sitting ready to grab and go...Hurricane Sandy was a true disaster - but where were you going to go, even if you grabbed? Water everywhere..and lots and lots of it.
customer_reviews.author: Moose MaGee

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good for starters. Need to add stuff to make complete, especially more water.
customer_reviews.author: claudia

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I hope we never have to use this item. The closet loves it's company
customer_reviews.author: Barbara

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: A great life-saving kit for weather calamities. I purchased this item just only as a backup in flood conditions. It includes every essential need like a flashlight, first-aid kit, emergency light, hand gloves, multi-purpose toolkit, poncho, food bar and many other things included in this emergency kit. All the total items 107 easily fits in Ready America backpack also can be easily stored in a reachable place in a home or car. I purchased a 4person deluxe emergency kit and also available in different variety like 1person or 2person. The main thing is food bar expiration date is a very long and can be replaceable once expire. I personally recommended this product everybody to keep Ready America Emergency Kit.
customer_reviews.author: nass

customer_reviews.title: This is a pretty good kit for a go bag
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty good kit for a go bag. My only complaint is that it was supposed to include 8 nitrile gloves, and they were missing from the set.
customer_reviews.author: sr393

customer_reviews.title: Glad I have the stuff inside
customer_reviews.text: The bag is a piece of junk. The zipper broke when I tried to open the bag for the first time. Glad I have the stuff inside, but the bag is worthless and will be thrown away.
customer_reviews.author: DC Shopper

customer_reviews.title: A nice survival kit (just in case if FEMA can't help you in time)
customer_reviews.text: Survival kit and emergency kit in case of disaster.. As of today, I never used it and hope to never use it... But what's inside is pretty much what you need when you will need it.
customer_reviews.author: jyves

customer_reviews.title: Nothing special
customer_reviews.text: The items in the bag and the bag itself is ok, but nothing special. As others say, it is not stocked with high quality products. However, it is a start......
customer_reviews.author: Leo’s

customer_reviews.title: Excellent emergency pack sealed properly and 5 years out on ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent emergency pack sealed properly and 5 years out on expiration date glad I purchased this item for my family!!
customer_reviews.author: Am

customer_reviews.title: Shelf life time Wrong on Purchase
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for 5 year shelf life and received items that have shelf life of 2 years - Not good ... Manufactured in 2017.
customer_reviews.author: Edwin

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Just the thing to keep in the trunk for those unexpected little movements of the earth, we love so much in earthquake country. Has everything you've ever thought you need and then some. Worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Theresa

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Good prepper bag for car. Adequate. Check at least yearly. Recommend for easy quick emergency preps.
customer_reviews.author: starZship

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: The bag didn't have extra pockets and one water box was damaged and empty
customer_reviews.author: Tweety

customer_reviews.title: My bag was black, but everything was was GREAT!
customer_reviews.text: Just arrived today. At first glance i was immediately disappointed because the box was half opened. Looks like tape was never applied to the outside edges of the flaps. Once I opened the box i was again disappointed to see that the bag was entirely black with the exception of small reflective strip and the "Ready America" lettering. I opened the bag and went though everything and everything listed is accounted for and fairly well organized within the bag itself. I would definitely recommend. I just wish i would have known that the bag would be black instead of the read. In case of emergency, the bright bag could be used for something. But, no big deal.
customer_reviews.author: Nadda Patatta

customer_reviews.title: Missing items
customer_reviews.text: Missing items. Both of the packs were missing the nitrile gloves and one of the packs was also missing 3 ponchos. Other than that, everything was in good condition and as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: R. Jaddi

customer_reviews.title: must have
customer_reviews.text: wish the bag was bigger so you could add to it. water very bulky, but if you get stuck in side of the road in winter this will be a useful thing to have at hand.
customer_reviews.author: jim curry

customer_reviews.title: Great Package for a catastrophe
customer_reviews.text: The package was well worth the wait. Every item was neatly packed and is easy to store away. Our family has embarked upon adding to our package. The backpack is amazing and gives us a staring point for creating additional packs. Kudos!
customer_reviews.author: kbrew

customer_reviews.title: L.Strozier
customer_reviews.text: Just what I'm gonna need when times get really bad, I have a feeling it won't be to long! @ least I'll be prepared for the occasion!
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Not Satisfied!
customer_reviews.text: Arrived this evening (11/20/2013) unpacked the boxes. Opened the backpack and took out the box of water and the box was soaked on about 1/4 of the package, the backpack on the bottom was even wet. Opened the soaked box containing the water containers and 3 of them were soaking wet, with actual water spots on them. So much for a five year shelf life! Wtf!!!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Peacock

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Really Great! Highly recommended! Hopefully will never have to use it all up!
customer_reviews.author: wakajawaka

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: We just had lots of little quakes here in LA. It prompted me to get prepared. This backpack is filled with essentials. I finally feel prepared!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Mercedes

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for as a "grab and ...
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was looking for as a "grab and go". Don't expect to load anything else in it but not overly heavy 15 lbs.>.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Just glad to have this in the car
customer_reviews.text: Peace of mind goes a long way, and with this kit in my wife's car, I know she and the kids will be ok if something happens. Its cheap when you consider what it's protecting. Just buy one.
customer_reviews.author: K. Sandbek

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love all that is included in this pack. We are now better prepared for an emergency
customer_reviews.author: wveersgirl

customer_reviews.title: Review
customer_reviews.text: It's got some good stuff in it. I got a crank flashlight and charger with mine. Worth the buy my husband had been trying to get me to make a bob. Done!
customer_reviews.author: JENNIFER L GOFF

customer_reviews.title: Very well packed and put together
customer_reviews.text: As other reviewers said, maybe not the most expensive quality stuff in bag, but really just what you need. I do not believe putting it together yourself makes it cheaper, certainly procrastinators will never get around to it. I really wanted the radio and phone charge and hope that works, cause its worth the price of admission. This was delivered quickly and will serve as a base for our needs. I will add our personal items, clothes etc. but I feel comfortable relying on this backpack and its contents if we are left "out in the cold" in an emergency.
customer_reviews.author: LeeSFV

customer_reviews.title: Better to be prepared
customer_reviews.text: Seems adequate I did add a lighter so we would have fire.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Charger on handcrank radio not compatible with most phones.
customer_reviews.text: Has all the basics, but the phone charger on the handcrank radio is pretty useless unless your phone is 10 years old.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan M Perry

customer_reviews.title: quality of product is excellent - only issue was the box with water in ...
customer_reviews.text: quality of product is excellent - only issue was the box with water in it was wet but none of the water pouches were leaking - but I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: T Keane

customer_reviews.title: Ready Backpack
customer_reviews.text: Now when that disater strikes at home, you can bug out with this pack with out worrying about the time to pack food???
customer_reviews.author: Gildar69

customer_reviews.title: Great beginner emergency kit. A MUST have In my opinion.
customer_reviews.text: Great beginner emergency kit. For the money you can't beat it. There are a few things I added to mine. IE. Knife, 2 crank 2-way radio's with full scanner, radio and light, extra MRE's (Meals ready to eat.) and water purification tablets as well as a basic EMT triage kit. This bag comes with plenty of room to add extra items. I recommend putting in anything bright RED or ORANGE to signal for help if needed (plastic bags work great). Also a signal mirror it a good item to add as well.
customer_reviews.author: ItsSaturday

customer_reviews.title: Loved the set up
customer_reviews.text: Loved the set up. Something's inside are not of the greatest quality. But I guess something is better then nothing.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice bug put bag. A little pricy but all in all worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Bulldog

customer_reviews.title: We purchased this to meet Foster Care Requirements
customer_reviews.text: We haven't had to open it or use it yet, but it met the requirements for California Foster Care and that is what we needed.
customer_reviews.author: Chris A.

product_meta.title: Ready America 70385 Deluxe Emergency Kit 4 Person Backpack
feature_bullets: US Coast Guard approved food and water
